Text.Value: Leave.
It began with a letter. There was no messenger - it simply... appeared.
You burn like fire, you howl like wind. You are Faithwarden.
I betrayed Silvanus himself, led the circle to shadow.
I won't forget the wounds I've inflicted. I pray Halsin returns to heal them in full.
We will stop the rite and I will stand trial. My fate lies with the Treefather, may He have mercy.
When you speak, the circles will listen. Among druids, your words will shine brighter than sun.
Take our gift and be known. May I not be the last monster you vanquish.

EditorData.logicalname: Staff is given when the flag is set

Text.Value: There was but one druid who guarded the circle, who protected our ways. We are forever in your debt.
Olodan came soon after. An army was coming, she said. Goblins, drow, and more still - legions upon legions.
I won't forget the wounds I've inflicted. I trust Silvanus will heal them in time.
Rath thought me a danger. Seems I've proven him right.
Meanwhile, help us contend with the goblins. Perhaps we can dissuade them from attacking.
You were ready to give up the circle to Cloakwood. It's unthinkable.
I can hardly deny it. I was so cloaked in shadow, little light could pierce through.
And what of Zevlor's people?
...well. You know the rest. I would turn the grove over to them.
Olodan taught me to harness the Treefather's power to wall us in. In return...
You once called me a monster. Seems I've proven you right.

EditorData.logicalname: HasMet - You called her monster before

Text.Value: What happens now?
We will stop the rite and I will stand trial. My fate lies with the Treefather, may He have mercy.
You don't deserve mercy.
What does it mean to be Faithwarden?
What about Zevlor - can his people stay?
However He judges, I will comply.
We will grant them safe harbour until they depart.
Yet I led a child to her death, betrayed the circle to shadow. We will stop the rite and I will stand trial.
A child is dead. I betrayed the circle's trust. We will stop the rite and I will stand trial.
Silvanus bid me to protect my people from harm. Yet I was the one to inflict it.
I endangered a child. I betrayed the circle's trust. We will stop the rite and I will stand trial.
Yet I betrayed Silvanus himself, led the circle to shadow. We will stop the rite and I will stand trial.
Rath thought me a danger. Seems I've proven him right.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Kagha produces a magical staff and gives to the player.

Text.Value: Silvanus may very well grant your wish. Traitors have died for lesser offences.
I won't forget the wounds I've inflicted. I trust First Druid Halsin will heal them in time.
I was thinking I could make us safe. A foolish notion, to think we'd find comfort in shadow.
My fate lies with Silvanus, may He have mercy.
Power's lure is strong. I know it well.
Protecting the circle was natural - but you chose the wrong path.
You're damned right. Joining the Shadow Druids? What were you thinking?
You speak more kindly than I deserve. I led a child to her death, betrayed the circle to shadow.
It was through power that I would keep us safe. Or so I thought.
Joining the Shadow Druids? What were you thinking?
You were lured by power. I've faced the same struggle.
The druids of Cloakwood knew the dangers this would bring. They ordained that all circles cast the rite to shelter from the storm.
How grateful I am that yours shone so brightly.
How did the Shadow Druids even find you?
Treefather keep us all.

Synopsis: You revealed Kagha to be a Shadow Druid, but convinced her to stand against them. She now contemplates what has happened, repentant and ready to stand trial for her crimes.
